results.title: Great Cognito
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton Productions and Will Vinton
results.brief_description: The most recent Will Vinton clay animated production introduces the Great Cognito a talented impersonator who really throws himself into his work. Accompanying his visual metamorphoses with a rapid-fire commentary, he entertains his audience with hilarious impersonations of public figures.

results.title: Great coastal dune show
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Department of Environment, Housing and Community Developments, this film adopts a satirical approach to the needs of a coastal dwelling nation like Australia actively trying to preserve coastline ecosystems. The film is short and its “message” is sharp: building on sand is insecure in more than one sense. Largely because of the humorous approach taken by the scriptwriter, the future impact of interference with dune communities should be felt by all audiences but, in particular, those who see the film in the classroom.

results.title: Great Cities of Europe
results.creator_credit: Adler Enterprises, Valentini, Calcon, International Video Network and James R. Conner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Enjoy a grand tour of Europe’s most renowned cities: London, Dublin, Amsterdam, Munich, Vienna, Salzburg, Paris, Madrid, Athens and Rome. See romantic castles, picturesque canals, lively piazzas and splendid parks; meet the Europeans at work and play.

results.title: Great Chimbu Pig Festival
results.creator_credit: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services
results.brief_description: Examines in detail the great festival of the Chimbu people of the Central Highlands of New Guinea. The festival is usually performed every five to eight years but Western influences have contributed to the seventeen year gap since the last ceremony. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services

results.title: Great cargoes
results.brief_description: Gathering crops in countries of the Empire for transportation to the United Kingdom. Then the industries using coal to produce steel, paper, textiles and glass making portholes for the Queen Mary. Electricity is taking over from coal to produce things from fertiliser to aeroplanes. The se are then shipped overseas to the Empire. Shows how ports are needed to accommodate the larger ships, reclaiming the mud flats for this purpose making an half mile quay after six year and ten million pounds.

results.title: Great Britain: Its geographical position
results.creator_credit: Gaumont, Frank Wells and Derek Mayne
results.brief_description: Great Britain is established as an island group off the coast of Europe. The appearance of the land when the Continental Shelf was above water is shown and the probable drainage of the area. Great Britain’s structure is related to the structure of Europe. The modifying effect of the North Atlantic drift and prevailing wind on Great Britain’s climate is next examined. This leads to an explanation of the development of cyclones in the North Atlantic, and their drift towards these islands, Finally, the film illustrates Great Britains; position in relations to sea and air communications.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef: marvels in miniature
results.brief_description: Living organisms taken from the waters of the coral reefs are examined under high power microscopes revealing the perfection of design and tremendous energies of minute creatures invisible to the unaided eye.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef (Italian)
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Richard Mason
results.brief_description: The Great Barrier Reef of Queensland is one of the great reservoirs of marine and animal life. This documentary shows in detail, the birds, fish and mammals of the area and the work being done by scientists in studying them. A long sequence deals with the life cycle of the turtle, another with the microscopic creatures of the sea.
